body.p: In response, the boards decided to remove the terms in use and in exchange and instead describe the objective of the valuation premise: the valuation premise assumes that an asset would be used either (a) in combination with other assets or with other assets and liabilities (formerly referred to as in use) or (b) on a stand‑alone basis (formerly referred to as in exchange). Respondents to the FASB’s proposed ASU generally supported that proposal. The boards concluded that the change improves the understandability of the valuation premise concept.
